revised_title: The Evolution of Medical Research and the National Institute for Medical Research
tldr: The article discusses the history and evolution of medical research, focusing on the establishment and development of the National Institute for Medical Research. It highlights the importance of academic freedom and the various methods employed by the institute to promote medical research, such as employing full-time investigators, providing assistance grants, and maintaining a statistical department. The article also touches upon the challenges faced by the institute during its early years, including the impact of World War I and the eventual transformation of the institute into the Medical Research Council.
